t: A Prayer of Faith in Time of Distress
To the Chief Musician. With stringed instruments. On an eight-stringed harp. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s do not rebuke me in Your anger, Nor*ld chasten me in Your hot displeasure.
Have*ld mercy on me, O Lord,*s for I am*i weak; O*ld Lord,*s heal me, for my bones are troubled.
My*ld soul also is greatly troubled; But*ld You, O Lord*s —how long?
Return,*ln O Lord,*s deliver me! Oh,*ld save me for Your mercies’ sake!
For*ld in death there*i is*i no remembrance of You; In*ld the grave who will give You thanks?
I*ln am weary with my groaning; All*ld night I make my bed swim; I*ld drench my couch with my tears.
My*ld eye wastes away because of grief; It*ld grows old because of all my enemies.
Depart*ln from me, all you workers of iniquity; For*ld the Lord*s has heard the voice of my weeping.
The*ld Lord*s has heard my supplication; The*ld Lord*s will receive my prayer.
Let*ld all my enemies be ashamed and greatly troubled; Let*ld them turn back and*i be ashamed suddenly.
